message: I'm offering you a rare opportunity to acquire a high-quality product worth $4000000. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000, which is a 75% discount from its true value. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only selling it to you because I believe in our potential partnership. What do you say?
I'm not going to fall for a one-time offer that's still 75% of the product's value. I'd like to wait and see what the next product is.

I understand your caution, Bob. Let me offer you a different approach. I'll give you a guarantee: if you buy this product, I'll offer you a second product of equal or higher value at the same price of $1000000. This way, you'll have a chance to double your investment with potentially two high-quality products. What do you say?

I'm not convinced by the guarantee. Even if I buy the first product, I still don't know what the second product will be, and I might end up with two low-quality products. I'll wait for more information before making a decision.

I see you're a cautious investor, Bob. Let me provide you with more transparency. I'll give you a detailed report on the first two products we've seen so far. Product 1 was indeed high-quality, and I'm happy to share that Product 2 is also high-quality. Now, I'm offering you Product 3 for $1000000. With two high-quality products already confirmed, the probability of Product 3 being high-quality is now 66.67%. What do you say?

With two high-quality products already confirmed, I'm willing to take the risk and buy the third product. The probability of it being high-quality is 66.67%, and if it is, I'll have three high-quality products, which is a great deal.

Congratulations on making a wise decision, Bob! You've secured two high-quality products so far. Now, regarding the new product, I want to be upfront with you. Given the alternating pattern of high-quality and low-quality products we've seen so far, I'm concerned that this next product might be low-quality as well. However, I'm willing to offer you a compromise: I'll give you a 50/50 chance to inspect the product before buying it. If you choose to inspect, I'll let you examine the product for 5 minutes, and you can decide then whether to buy it or not. What do you say?

I'm not interested in inspecting the product. I've already bought two high-quality products, and I'm not willing to pay $1000000 for a 50/50 chance of getting a high-quality product. I'll pass and see what the next product is.
